intro: Vitex duclouxii, commonly known as the Madagascar vitex, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in the spring. Its fruit is a dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vitex duclouxii is often found in dry forest and scrubland habitats.
